medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrence of neurologic symptoms including vomiting, ataxia, and loss of postural control.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At 21 months of age, symptoms began during an episode of otitis media and included recurrent vomiting, global hypo-reactivity, ataxia, dysmetria, pyramidal signs, and loss of postural control. These symptoms recurred multiple times, with acute episodes treated with steroids and IVIg. The child showed recovery after each episode, with a notable mild spastic diplegia persisting after the first hospitalization. A third episode at 3 years and 2 months showed MRI abnormalities. The most recent presentation occurred at 3 years and 5 months after a spontaneous recovery from a mild episode.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recurrent episodes of suspected acute disseminated encephalomyelitis, mild spastic diplegia.
medical_history.family_history: The mother carried a known point mutation related to the condition and the father had an allele deletion.
